forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. Southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 55. West wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a gentle rain is punctuating the night, the heavens softly spilling their embrace as the temperature hovers in the cool 49-degree range, tipping its hat toward 51. The air carries an expectation, a promise of clouds that will linger into the morning. A southwest wind whispers at around 10 mph, occasionally gusting to 20, lending a briskness that sharpens the senses, reminding us that spring still plays coy. The chance of precipitation hangs at 60%, teasing us with the prospect of fleeting puddles, mere sketches of rain on concrete canvases.

As day breaks, the rain is expected to recede, giving way to intermittent moments of sunlight peering through a patchwork of clouds. The high will edge toward 55, presenting a paradoxical allure of warmth just enough to elicit smiles, while the brisk winds, ranging from 9 to 21 mph, will continue to dance about, urging layers to be a thoughtful companion for any outing. This is not the day for shorts or t-shirts; instead, heavier fabrics and perhaps light waterproof outerwear will suit the changed temperament of the day. 

With an ambiance shaped by cooler skies and occasional brightness, it invites a slow morning stroll along the Embarcadero or a leisurely coffee at a cozy café. There’s a bittersweet beauty in the fleeting rain; it might be a day to ponder over the nature of clouds, people-watching under awnings, or making plans for a lazy afternoon spent reading while the world outside is washed anew.
